name: The Red Hook
description: Here's a relative of the Manhattan that dates to within the past five years, a drink created by New York bartender Enzo Errico that utilizes its ancestor's rye whiskey base, matches it with the bitter Italian vermouth Punt e Mes, and fills in the flavor with a hearty dose of funky maraschino liqueur. Named for a once rough-and-tumble Brooklyn neighborhood that's since changed with the times, the Red Hook is one of the more memorable variations of the Manhattan.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 to 1/2 ounce maraschino liqueur, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Pour ingredients into mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir briskly for 30 seconds; strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
